frame.name: Invading
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Invader</fen> enters a <fex name="Land">Land</fex> in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.
<ex><fex name="Time">In August 1990</fex> ,<fex name="Invader">Iraq</fex> was <t>invading</t> <fex name="Land">Kuwait</fex> , which led to the Gulf war .</ex>
<ex>Some towns in Russia were ravaged by <fex name="Invader">barbarian</fex> <t>invasions</t> <fex name="Time">in the thirteenth century</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Land
FE.definition:
<def-root>The political area that is being crippled by the <fen>Invader</fen>'s entry.
<ex>Henry II had made no attempt to <t>invade</t> <fex name="Land">France.</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Invader</fen> to assist in the invasion of the <fen>Land</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Invader
FE.definition:
<def-root>The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the <fen>Land</fen> in a hostile manner.
<ex>Indeed , three months later <fex name="Invader">Hitler</fex> <t>invaded</t> Austria.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Invader</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Invader</fen> that accomplishes the assault.
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the location where the <fen>Invader</fen> invades the <fen>Land</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Invader</fen> attacks the <fen>Land</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Invader</fen> is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the <fen>Land</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Invader</fen> invades <fen>Land</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Invader</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Invader</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Land</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Invader</fen> or <fen>Land</fen> while the Invasion occurs.
</def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the invasion on the <fen>Land</fen> by the <fen>Invader</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole and describes and describes the event more generally.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Invader</fen> travels. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Invader</fen> invades the <fen>Land</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the subtype of invasion into the <fen>Land</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes how intense the invation of the <fen>Land</fen> is.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>For how long the <fen>Land</fen> is invaded by the <fen>Invader</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: invade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: aggressively enter into a region.

lexUnit.name: overrun.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: invade an area in great numbers

lexUnit.name: invader.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who aggressively intrudes into a region
